backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor defining Video, ScheduledPost, and Itinerary types with CRUD operations for two workspaces (travel/aiLearning) and three platforms (facebook/instagram/tiktok), including blob storage mixin for file uploads.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting three authentication-related features in VideoUpload.tsx: hiding login button when authenticated, reading isAuthenticated state correctly, and removing duplicate login logic causing errors.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Pre-existing summaries of frontend components describing the app structure: workspace management, video upload with authentication, media library, calendar scheduling, and AI caption generation with manual posting workflow.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with dark theme OKLCH color variables for background, foreground, primary, secondary, muted, accent, destructive, border, and chart colors in both light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with viewport meta tag, 'NicheHub' title, root div, and module script loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component wrapping the app in ThemeProvider (dark mode), WorkspaceProvider, Layout, and three-tab navigation (Media Library, Schedule, Script Lab) with Toaster for notifications.
frontend/src/components/Calendar.tsx: Monthly calendar view with prev/next navigation, displaying scheduled posts per date, supporting drag-and-drop of videos onto dates to trigger TimePickerModal for scheduling.
frontend/src/components/DateTimePickerMo: Modal dialog with calendar date picker and time input for scheduling posts, validating that selected datetime is in the future before confirming.
frontend/src/components/HelpModal.tsx: Informational modal explaining the four-step workflow: upload videos, generate AI captions, schedule posts, and manually copy/paste to social platforms.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Main layout component with header, footer, and authentication controls. Handles Internet Identity login/logout with toast notifications and includes a help modal trigger.
frontend/src/components/MediaLibrary.tsx: Displays a grid of uploaded videos with upload functionality. Manages video selection for repurposing and playback through modal dialogs.
frontend/src/components/RepurposeModal.t: Modal dialog for generating and editing AI-powered captions for Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok. Includes platform selection, caption editing, copy functionality, and scheduling integration.
frontend/src/components/ScheduleButton.t: Button component that opens a date-time picker modal and handles scheduling posts across multiple platforms with caption data.
frontend/src/components/ScheduledPostIte: Displays a single scheduled post with thumbnail, time, platform icons, and a copy-to-clipboard button for captions.
frontend/src/components/ScriptLab.tsx: AI-powered script generation tool for travel videos that creates editable itinerary scripts with hook, daily breakdown, and CTA sections.
Modal for selecting time and platforms when scheduling a post, with integrated caption generation and validation for future dates.
frontend/src/components/VideoCard.tsx: Displays a video card with thumbnail/preview, caption, drag-and-drop support, play overlay on hover, and a repurpose button. Handles click events to play video while preventing button clicks from triggering playback.
frontend/src/components/VideoPlayerModal: Modal dialog component that displays a full-screen video player with controls and autoplay. Shows the video caption as the dialog title.
frontend/src/components/VideoUpload.tsx: Handles video file selection, thumbnail generation, and upload with progress tracking. Requires Internet Identity authentication and displays upload progress or login prompt based on auth state.
Toggle component for switching between Travel and AI Learning workspaces. Displays two buttons with icons and persists selection via WorkspaceContext.
frontend/src/contexts/WorkspaceContext.t: React context provider for managing workspace state (Travel or AI Learning) with localStorage persistence. Provides workspace getter and setter to child components.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance based on Internet Identity authentication state. Invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context and hooks with login, logout, and identity state management. Creates and manages AuthClient with configurable options and delegation handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching videos and scheduled posts by workspace, and a mutation hook for uploading videos with progress tracking using ExternalBlob. Handles query invalidation and toast notifications.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for dark theme colors, spacing, and design tokens. Includes touch-friendly minimum sizes and smooth scrolling for mobile.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query client and Internet Identity provider, then renders the App component into the root DOM element.
frontend/src/utils/captionGenerator.ts: Generates platform-specific social media captions (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok) from an original caption with simulated AI delay, adding appropriate hashtags, emojis, and platform-optimized formatting.
frontend/src/utils/itineraryGenerator.ts: Generates a structured 3-day travel itinerary script with a hook, daily activities, and CTA from a video caption, simulating AI generation with a 2-second delay.
frontend/src/utils/thumbnailGenerator.ts: Extracts a JPEG thumbnail from a video file by seeking to 1 second or 10% duration, drawing the frame to canvas, and converting to Uint8Array with detailed logging.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom color scheme using OKLCH color space, extended theme with sidebar/chart colors, custom animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing NicheHub as a mobile-first content management app with workspace management, AI caption generation, calendar scheduling, Internet Identity auth, and known issues with video upload and login button errors.
